title: American Airlines introduces premier seating for PETS for just £80 (and, of course, it's called Cuddle Class)
text:
View
comments
The US-based carrier, American Airlines, are taking pet pampering to new heights.
They've just introduced a preferred seating programme for premier passengers' cuddly friends.
Anyone flying First Class from Los Angeles or San Francisco to New York on A321T planes will now be able to seat their pets in special compartments adjacent to their seat.
American Airlines has introduced a preferred seating programme for dogs and cats on board two of their domestic US routes
'[We] designed the special First Class pet cabins...to make it easier for customers to travel with their jet-setting pets,' a spokesman told Travel + Leisure .
'It's a unique feature, and it's becoming popular with trendsetters.'

The cabin, nicknamed 'Cuddle Class,' must be reserved at the same time as you book your flight, and documentation from a veterinarian is required.
'Cuddle Class' boasts two berths at the front bulkhead that each have a space with a vented door to hold a kennel or carrying case for takeoff and landing.
Now First Class passengers will be able to keep their furry friends in a special, vented compartment adjacent to their seat
It has already been dubbed the 'Paris Hilton compartment', in honour of the celebrity who often flies with her dogs.
The usual $125 (£80) carry-on pet fee is the only cost, which is nothing considering a round-trip First Class ticket runs to $8,000 (£4,895) to fly between the cities.
It's also worth mentioning that while either dogs or cats can fly, your pet must be able to fit in the standard 19inch x 13inch travel container.
